title: 'Drunk mother made starving kids live in feces-filled house that had booze but no food'
text:
Tracy Shields was after police discovered the deplorable conditions of her home. (Picture: Fox 6)

A mother who got ‘drunk everyday’ made her kids live in a animal-feces filled house that had no food or running water – but plenty of booze, authorities said.

Tracey Shields, 43, was arrested for chronic child neglect and physical abuse after police discovered her home was so filthy it was unfit for humans, or even animals.

Shields reportedly had six children living in the house that was filled with rats, insects, and animal feces in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Police wrote the ‘pungent smell of the home could be smelled from outside the house. There were rats running along the outside of the home.’

‘The entire inside of the home was covered in animal feces, infested with flies, and filled with garbage. It was nearly impossible to walk through the home due to the amount of animal feces and garbage on the floor.’

The report continued to say that the ‘bathroom sink was overflowing with garbage, making it unusable.’

Authorities said that their was no ‘edible food’ in the home, just alcohol, adding ‘It did not appear that the home had running water.’

Dog walker, 68, 'smashed young boy's face into ground after being hit by snowball'

Neighbors said they felt terrible for Shields’s children, but were not completely shocked by her arrest.

An unnamed Neighbor told Fox 6: ‘It’s awful. The whole neighborhood suspected what was going on.’ ‘

‘She would be outside just totally belligerent. One gentleman in particular we know went and actually cleaned the house at one given time because of the kids’ situation.’

Police said the home could be smelled throughout the entire neighborhood (Picture: Fox 6)

‘We would let them play in the pool. We would let them eat with my grandson. Everything, we knew they haven’t been fed,’ said the neighbor.

Shields is also accused of biting one of her children in the face.

Cop 'sodomized woman after inviting her and her wife into his hot tub'

When police arrested Shields, she was ‘swaying and slurring her words’ and told one officer ‘I can drink when I want to,’ according to the complaint.

Shields appeared in court on Thursday and her bond was set at $1,000. She is due back on October 31. It is unclear whether the children were placed with a relative or taken into custody of the state.
description: Shields reportedly had six children living in the house that was allegedly filled with rats, insects, and animal feces in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
